org.aoplib4j.uml.internal
Class SequenceDiagramAspect

java.lang.Object
  org.aoplib4j.uml.internal.SequenceDiagramAspect

public final class SequenceDiagramAspect
extends java.lang.Object

Aspect that implements the creation of a sequence diagram. The aspect use the percflow association; an aspect instance will be created for every method annotated with the Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram. For every annotated method, the aspect will create(write) a sequence diagram using as writer an instance of the class passed as parameter to Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram.diagramWriter()

Author:
Adrian Citu
See Also:
sequenceDiagramMethodStartPointcut(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram), Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram, SequenceDiagramWriter

Field Detail

THREAD_LOCAL

private static final java.lang.ThreadLocal<java.util.List<SequenceDiagramAspect>> THREAD_LOCAL
Objects containing aspect instances; this is useful and used in the case of nested annotations (method annotated containing inside own flow another annotated methods).

insideSequenceDiagram

private boolean insideSequenceDiagram
Boolean which is true if the aspect execution is inside a sequence diagram, false otherwise. This lag is used by the validSequenceDiagramPointcut() which is an if pointcut to see if a method is executed inside the diagram or outside.

seqDiagram

private SequenceDiagram seqDiagram
Sequence diagram object attached; contains all the information concerning the diagram(path, writer).

private static final java.util.logging.Logger LOGGER
the logger to use.

the name under which a constructor will appear in the diagrams.

SequenceDiagramAspect

public SequenceDiagramAspect()
Method Detail

sequenceDiagramMethodStartPointcut

public void sequenceDiagramMethodStartPointcut(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram seqAnnot)
Pointcut representing the execution of the methods annotated with the Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram annotation. The pointcut represents the starting point of the sequencediagram. 
 AspectJ pointcut:
 
 execution(@org.aoplib4j.uml.Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram * * (..))
      && @annotation(seqAnnot)

Parameters:
seqAnnot - the annotation of the method (it will be used to retrieve the parameters).

validSequenceDiagramPointcut

public static boolean validSequenceDiagramPointcut()
Pointcut used to distinguish if a(nother) pointcut is a valid pointcut for the writing of the diagram. A pointcut is valid if :
  • the pointcut is inside of the control flow of the sequenceDiagramMethodStartPointcut(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram) pointcut, so the insideSequenceDiagram is true. 
    • (AND)
  • the current depth of the diagram is smaller or equal than the maximum diagram depth.
The pointcut is represented by a static boolean method because of the use of the if() pointcut (see 7.3.2 from AspectJ in action 2 ed.) 
 AspectJ pointcut:
  if()

Returns:
true if the program flow is in the control flow of the sequenceDiagramMethodStartPointcut(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram) false otherwise.

sequenceMethodsPointcut

public void sequenceMethodsPointcut()
Pointcut containing the execution of all the methods and constructors inside of the sequence diagram. To know if the pointcut is inside the sequence diagram the validSequenceDiagramPointcut() is used. 
   AspectJ pointcut:
   validSequenceDiagramPointcut()
  && (execution(* *.*(..)) || execution(*.new(..)))
  && !within (org.aoplib4j.uml.internal.SequenceDiagramAspect.*) 
  && !cflow (execution (* org.aoplib4j.uml.SequenceDiagramWriter+.*(..)))"
  && !within (org.aoplib4j.uml.SequenceDiagram)
  && !within (org.aoplib4j.uml.SequenceMethod+)
  && !within (org.aoplib4j.*.internal.*)

See Also:
validSequenceDiagramPointcut()

sequenceMethodBefore

private void sequenceMethodBefore(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint jp)
Method executed before the execution of any method belonging to a sequence diagram. The method do not use the this instance, instead retrieves the aspect instances from the local thread object (THREAD_LOCAL) because the behavior of this method can/should be applied to ALL the method of ALL the aspects. For every aspect instance a new SequenceMethod is created and attached to the SequenceDiagram of every aspect instance.

Parameters:
jp - AspectJ join point.

sequenceMethodAfter

private void sequenceMethodAfter(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint jp)
Method executed after the execution of any method belonging to a sequence diagram. The method do not use the this instance, instead retrieves the aspect instances from the local thread object (THREAD_LOCAL) because the behavior of this method can/should be applied to ALL the method of ALL the aspects. For every aspect instance, the active method is changed; the active method became the parent of the actual active method and the depth of the diagram is decreased.

Parameters:
jp - AspectJ join point.

sequenceMethodsAroundAdvice

public java.lang.Object sequenceMethodsAroundAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                                             throws java.lang.Throwable
Advice executed around the methods inside the sequence diagram (all the methods beside the annotated method/root method). This method calls the sequenceMethodBefore(JoinPoint), ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed() and sequenceMethodAfter(JoinPoint).

Parameters:
pjp - the AspectJ proceeding pointcut.
Returns:
the result of the advice execution.
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - exception thrown by the advice execution.

sequenceMethodStartBeforeForThis

private void sequenceMethodStartBeforeForThis(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram seqAnnot,
                                              org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                                       throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                              java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Method that will create for the current aspect instance a new diagram and the attached writer. This method should only be called by the sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice( Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram, ProceedingJoinPoint)

Parameters:
seqAnnot - the annotation.
pjp - object created by AspectJ framework providing access to the around advice.
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException - if the creation of diagram writer fails.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the creation of diagram writer fails.

sequenceMethodStartAfterForAllInstances

private void sequenceMethodStartAfterForAllInstances(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
Parameters:
pjp - object created by AspectJ framework providing access to the around advice. This method should only be called by the sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice( Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram, ProceedingJoinPoint)

sequenceMethodStartAfterForThis

private void sequenceMethodStartAfterForThis()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Method called at the end of the sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice . The method call the SequenceDiagramWriter.write(SequenceMethod) and close the writer attached to the diagram writer. This method should only be called by the sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice( Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram, ProceedingJoinPoint)

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the diagram writing fails.

sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice

public java.lang.Object sequenceMethodStartAroundAdvice(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram seqAnnot,
                                                        org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                                                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Method executed around the first method (root method) of the sequence diagram. The method flow is:
  • call sequenceMethodBefore(JoinPoint)
  • call sequenceMethodStartBeforeForThis( Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram, ProceedingJoinPoint)
  • call ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed()
  • call sequenceMethodStartAfterForThis()
  • call sequenceMethodStartAfterForAllInstances(ProceedingJoinPoint)

Parameters:
seqAnnot - the annotation.
pjp - object created by AspectJ framework providing access to the around advice.
Returns:
the result of the joinpoint execution.
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - the exception thrown by the joinpoint execution;since the aspect cannot treat it, just throw it further.

createSequenceMethodInstance

private SequenceMethod createSequenceMethodInstance(org.aspectj.lang.Signature sig,
                                                    SequenceMethod... parent)
Create SequenceMethod object by retrieving all the needed informations from the Signature object (method name, method return value, method parameters).

Parameters:
sig - AspectJ signature
parent - the parent method; optional parameter.
Returns:
a new instance of sequence method.

createWriterInstance

private SequenceDiagramWriter createWriterInstance(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram seqAnnot,
                                                   org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
                                            throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                   java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Method that creates an instance of SequenceDiagramWriter. The needed information are the writer class (retrieved from the Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram.diagramWriter()) and the diagram full path Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram.diagramFullPath()). If the diagram full path have the default value (empty string "") then a new default pat is computed and will be java.io.tmpdir/className.methodName().txt

Parameters:
seqAnnot - annotation to retrieve the class to instantiate.
jpsp - AspectJ static join point.
Returns:
instance of the class retrieved from the Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram.diagramWriter().
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the instantiation fails (introspection is used)
java.lang.InstantiationException - if the instantiation fails (introspection is used)

getDiagramFullPath

private java.lang.String getDiagramFullPath(Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram seqAnnot,
                                            org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
Compute the diagram full path from the annotation. If the Aoplib4jSequenceDiagram.diagramFullPath() is "" (default value) then the new diagram path will be java.io.tmpdir/ClassName.MethodName.txt

Parameters:
seqAnnot - the annotation
jpsp - the AspectJ static join point.
Returns:
the full path where the diagram will be written.

getJavaIoTmpDir

private static java.lang.String getJavaIoTmpDir()
On some plateform, the temporary directory returned by java.io.tmpdir do not include a trailing slash. That is:
Win NT --> C:\TEMP\
Win XP --> C:\TEMP
Solaris --> /var/tmp/
Linux --> /var/tmp

Returns:
returns value of "java.io.tmpdir" system property with a System.getProperty("file.separator") character at the and despite the platform(*NIX, Win, etc..)

addAspectToThread

Add a new aspect instance to the local thread variable.

Parameters:
asp - the new instance.

removeAspectFromThread

private static void removeAspectFromThread(SequenceDiagramAspect asp)
Remove the aspect instance from the local thread variable.

Parameters:
asp - the instance to remove.
